connector.description: Transfer data securely and reliably using the AS2 protocol (RFC4130).

camel.source.path.apiName.name: camel.source.path.apiName
camel.source.path.apiName.description: What kind of operation to perform One of: [CLIENT] [SERVER]

camel.source.path.methodName.name: camel.source.path.methodName
camel.source.path.methodName.description: What sub operation to use for the selected operation

camel.source.endpoint.as2From.name: camel.source.endpoint.as2From
camel.source.endpoint.as2From.description: The value of the AS2From header of AS2 message.

camel.source.endpoint.as2MessageStructur.name: camel.source.endpoint.as2MessageStructure
camel.source.endpoint.as2MessageStructur.description: The structure of AS2 Message. One of: PLAIN - No encryption, no signature, SIGNED - No encryption, signature, ENCRYPTED - Encryption, no signature, ENCRYPTED_SIGNED - Encryption, signature One of: [PLAIN] [SIGNED] [ENCRYPTED] [SIGNED_ENCRYPTED] [PLAIN_COMPRESSED] [SIGNED_COMPRESSED] [ENCRYPTED_COMPRESSED] [ENCRYPTED_COMPRESSED_SIGNED]

camel.source.endpoint.as2To.name: camel.source.endpoint.as2To
camel.source.endpoint.as2To.description: The value of the AS2To header of AS2 message.

camel.source.endpoint.as2Version.name: camel.source.endpoint.as2Version
camel.source.endpoint.as2Version.description: The version of the AS2 protocol. One of: [1.0] [1.1]

camel.source.endpoint.clientFqdn.name: camel.source.endpoint.clientFqdn
camel.source.endpoint.clientFqdn.description: The Client Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN). Used in message ids sent by endpoint.

camel.source.endpoint.compressionAlgorit.name: camel.source.endpoint.compressionAlgorithm
camel.source.endpoint.compressionAlgorit.description: The algorithm used to compress EDI message. One of: [ZLIB]

camel.source.endpoint.decryptingPrivateK.name: camel.source.endpoint.decryptingPrivateKey
camel.source.endpoint.decryptingPrivateK.description: The key used to encrypt the EDI message.

camel.source.endpoint.dispositionNotific.name: camel.source.endpoint.dispositionNotificationTo
camel.source.endpoint.dispositionNotific.description: The value of the Disposition-Notification-To header. Assigning a value to this parameter requests a message disposition notification (MDN) for the AS2 message.

camel.source.endpoint.ediMessageTransfer.name: camel.source.endpoint.ediMessageTransferEncoding
camel.source.endpoint.ediMessageTransfer.description: The transfer encoding of EDI message.

camel.source.endpoint.ediMessageType.name: camel.source.endpoint.ediMessageType
camel.source.endpoint.ediMessageType.description: The content type of EDI message. One of application/edifact, application/edi-x12, application/edi-consent

camel.source.endpoint.encryptingAlgorith.name: camel.source.endpoint.encryptingAlgorithm
camel.source.endpoint.encryptingAlgorith.description: The algorithm used to encrypt EDI message. One of: [AES128_CBC] [AES192_CBC] [AES256_CBC] [AES128_CCM] [AES192_CCM] [AES256_CCM] [AES128_GCM] [AES192_GCM] [AES256_GCM] [CAMELLIA128_CBC] [CAMELLIA192_CBC] [CAMELLIA256_CBC] [CAST5_CBC] [DES_CBC] [DES_EDE3_CBC] [GOST28147_GCFB] [IDEA_CBC] [RC2_CBC] [RC4] [SEED_CBC]

camel.source.endpoint.encryptingCertific.name: camel.source.endpoint.encryptingCertificateChain
camel.source.endpoint.encryptingCertific.description: The chain of certificates used to encrypt EDI message.

camel.source.endpoint.from.name: camel.source.endpoint.from
camel.source.endpoint.from.description: The value of the From header of AS2 message.

camel.source.endpoint.inBody.name: camel.source.endpoint.inBody
camel.source.endpoint.inBody.description: Sets the name of a parameter to be passed in the exchange In Body

camel.source.endpoint.mdnMessageTemplate.name: camel.source.endpoint.mdnMessageTemplate
camel.source.endpoint.mdnMessageTemplate.description: The template used to format MDN message

camel.source.endpoint.requestUri.name: camel.source.endpoint.requestUri
camel.source.endpoint.requestUri.description: The request URI of EDI message.

camel.source.endpoint.server.name: camel.source.endpoint.server
camel.source.endpoint.server.description: The value included in the Server message header identifying the AS2 Server.

camel.source.endpoint.serverFqdn.name: camel.source.endpoint.serverFqdn
camel.source.endpoint.serverFqdn.description: The Server Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN). Used in message ids sent by endpoint.

camel.source.endpoint.signedReceiptMicAl.name: camel.source.endpoint.signedReceiptMicAlgorithms
camel.source.endpoint.signedReceiptMicAl.description: The list of algorithms, in order of preference, requested to generate a message integrity check (MIC) returned in message dispostion notification (MDN)

camel.source.endpoint.signingAlgorithm.name: camel.source.endpoint.signingAlgorithm
camel.source.endpoint.signingAlgorithm.description: The algorithm used to sign EDI message. One of: [SHA3_224WITHRSA] [SHA3_256WITHRSA] [SHA3_384withRSA] [SHA3_512WITHRSA] [MD5WITHRSA] [SHA1WITHRSA] [MD2WITHRSA] [SHA224WITHRSA] [SHA256WITHRSA] [SHA384WITHRSA] [SHA512WITHRSA] [RIPEMD128WITHRSA] [RIPEMD160WITHRSA] [RIPEMD256WITHRSA] [SHA224WITHDSA] [SHA256WITHDSA] [SHA384WITHDSA] [SHA512WITHDSA] [SHA3_224WITHDSA] [SHA3_256WITHDSA] [SHA3_384WITHDSA] [SHA3_512WITHDSA] [SHA1WITHDSA] [SHA3_224WITHECDSA] [SHA3_256WITHECDSA] [SHA3_384WITHECDSA] [SHA3_512WITHECDSA] [SHA1WITHECDSA] [SHA224WITHECDSA] [SHA256WITHECDSA] [SHA384WITHECDSA] [SHA512WITHECDSA] [SHA1WITHPLAIN_ECDSA] [SHA224WITHPLAIN_ECDSA] [SHA256WITHPLAIN_ECDSA] [SHA384WITHPLAIN_ECDSA] [SHA512WITHPLAIN_ECDSA] [RIPEMD160WITHPLAIN_ECDSA] [SHA1WITHRSAANDMGF1] [SHA224WITHRSAANDMGF1] [SHA256WITHRSAANDMGF1] [SHA384WITHRSAANDMGF1] [SHA512WITHRSAANDMGF1] [SHA3_224WITHRSAANDMGF1] [SHA3_256WITHRSAANDMGF1] [SHA3_384WITHRSAANDMGF1] [SHA3_512WITHRSAANDMGF1]

camel.source.endpoint.signingCertificate.name: camel.source.endpoint.signingCertificateChain
camel.source.endpoint.signingCertificate.description: The chain of certificates used to sign EDI message.

camel.source.endpoint.signingPrivateKey.name: camel.source.endpoint.signingPrivateKey
camel.source.endpoint.signingPrivateKey.description: The key used to sign the EDI message.

camel.source.endpoint.subject.name: camel.source.endpoint.subject
camel.source.endpoint.subject.description: The value of Subject header of AS2 message.

camel.source.endpoint.targetHostname.name: camel.source.endpoint.targetHostname
camel.source.endpoint.targetHostname.description: The host name (IP or DNS name) of target host.

camel.source.endpoint.targetPortNumber.name: camel.source.endpoint.targetPortNumber
camel.source.endpoint.targetPortNumber.description: The port number of target host. -1 indicates the scheme default port.

camel.source.endpoint.userAgent.name: camel.source.endpoint.userAgent
camel.source.endpoint.userAgent.description: The value included in the User-Agent message header identifying the AS2 user agent.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.component.as2.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.component.as2.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.as2.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.as2.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.as2.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.as2.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
